characters: SLOW MOTION OF THE TRUCK PLOWING THROUGH THE DINING ROOM
ELLIE CROUCHED IN THE SHADOWS BEHIND HIM
TABLE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DARK ROAD
IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROAD WHERE ELLIE WAS HIT BY THE TRUC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG AERIAL SHOT over a sea of DARK WOODS. The moon hangs over the trees on the horizon, obscured by thin clouds. A cluster of lights below us. The sleepy town of LUDLOW, MAINE. We pass over HOUSES nestled around ponds, a quaint downtown, tiny roads branching into the surrounding hills The last of the houses slips away below as we move furthe out over the endless trees, slowly descending down into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're inside the woods now. Moon flickering through branc as we pick up a NARROW PATH winding through the trees. Ou POV slows as we settle on a wooden sign nailed to a tree. In hand painted childish scrawl it reads: PET SEMATARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we HOLD on the sign, there’s a NOISE in the darkness. ANIMAL FEET crunching through pine needles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shape of a DOG comes into view. Just a shadow standin in the trail. Hulking, fur clumped and dirty. Eyes black. The ragged dog walks down the trail past us as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide, grassy lawn near the edge of the woods. Toys left out for the night. A sprinkler tapping softly somewhere. There’s a LIGHT in the second story window as -- The dog from the woods moves into frame. It stands still a long BEAT in the darkness. Looking at that window as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG BOY (9) sleeping in bed. A model of the solar sys travels in mechanical circles over his head. After a BEAT  2. The boy opens his eyes, sensing something. After a BEAT, slides out of bed. As his feet come to the floor we NOTIC A shovel and some dirty clothes stashed under the bed. The boy crosses to the window, peering out to -- THE BACKYARD. Toys. Sprinkler. No sign of the dog. He walks to his bedroom door, slowly opening it to REVEAL Nothing there. Just an empty dark hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy moves down the hall followed by his elongated SHA that bends up the wall. He pauses by his parent’s room, glancing at his MOTHER and FATHER sleeping in their bed. He continues past their door, turning down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes and toys. A clock ticking softly. After a BEAT -- The Boy comes down the stairs. He moves across the room t the front window, pulling the curtain back to peek out -- POV of the porch... the stairs... the empty lawn. Then -- A DARK SHAPE slips past! The boy presses against the wall, terror rising as we HEA Two soft SCRATCHES on the outside of the door. Something wants to come inside. The boy stands for a BEAT not believing what he knows to be true. Afraid to move. After a BEAT, he steps closer, reaching for the door -- CLOSE as he turns the knob, pulling it open to REVEAL -- Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sprinkler taps lightly along the side of the house as BOY comes down the porch stairs to the lawn in his pajama He squints into the shadows, barely able to form the word

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck? That you, boy? The house looms behind him, front door hanging open as th boy steps further out onto the lawn. BEHIND HIM we notice A dog shaped SHADOW slinking across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy hears the noise and spins to SEE -- BUCK, the dog from the woods, standing in the shadows. Th dog's head hangs low, breathing slow and ragged. The boy steps closer, eyes filled with wonder and awe.

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come back. Jesse said it wouldn’t work but I just knew... The boy stops as Buck moves into the light. Drool swings from his mouth, eyes heavy. A bloody scar over his eye.

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You hungry? Want some food? Buck just stares back. Dead eyes locked on the boy.

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Buck, it’s me. You’re okay now. Buck steps forward. A hint of BLACKNESS swirls in his eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy glances at the open door. He desperately wants to turn and run as the dog’s mouth tightens into a growl.

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay outside, okay? 1I/’11 bring you some food... The boy turns toward the house, trying to walk slowly as SQUEEEK!!! He steps on a plastic DOG TOY on the lawn. The boy looks over his shoulder as the dog charges. He ru for the house in his pajamas, the dog gaining ground behi him. The boy hits the stairs, slipping and scrambling ont the porch... the open front door only a few feet away -- But he slips. Crashing to the ground on his chest. Lights go on in the house. We hear voices coming from upstairs. CLOSE on the boy’s terrified face as he slowly lifts hims onto his hands to look back over his shoulder and SEE --  The dog in the shadows. Eyes pure black. Teeth bared. The boy scrambles for the open door as the dog -- LUNGES RIGHT INTO CAMERA and we -- SMASH TO BLACK. The screaming, snarling dog attack fades into the flutter sound of a playing card in the spokes of a bike as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the wheel of a bike with two PLAYING CARDS pinne the front forks with laundry pins. PULL OUT to REVEAL -- ELLIE (9), hair flowing behind her, eyes shining with lif she steers her bike up onto the sidewalk and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driveway of a modest, single story home on a block wi dozen identical single story homes. Ellie slows down by t real estate sign in the front yard that exclaims: SOLD! GAGE (3) sees Ellie on her bike and his face lights up --

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Ellie home! Ellie’s parents RACHEL and LOUIS look up from cramming th last of their belongings into a station wagon. They’re sweating and tired from packing. Rachel glances at Louis.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let me talk to her. Rachel comes over to Ellie, looking a little concerned --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where'd you go, honey? Thought you were just saying goodbye to Stephanie? Ellie pulls a cute mouse-shaped CAT TOY out of her pocket

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t want Church to be bored. Rachel’s heart melts. Ellie is thoughtful and sensitive. Louis comes up behind them to grab Ellie’s bike. He paus for a moment, checking in with her.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You gonna be okay? Ellie nods but we can see she’s a little unsure.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: You think the kids at my new school will be nice? Louis kneels down, brushing the hair out of her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: They're going to love you, El. Rachel comes over, taking a last look at their old house

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good bye, Boston.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: AERIAL SHOTS over BOSTON, bays and bridges spill out belo A tangle of buildings, roads and waterways as we PICK UP The STATION WAGON crossing the ZAKIM BRIDGE, heading out the city. The car drives up I-95, through coastal towns, waterways, finally past a sign reading: WELCOME TO MAINE. Rural and beautiful. The car turns inland on a small high winding up into the woods as the sun sinks behind the tre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis drives while Rachel navigates. Ellie and Gage sit i back, Church in his pet carrier between them. Gage bangs Church's carrier with a toy to get Ellie’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Ellie. Ellie. Ellie-phant!

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Mom? It’s not fair to Church. Rachel glances back. Church is sleeping with his new toy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure Church is okay. Ellie turns to the window, ignoring Gage as Louis slows d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be some kind of ordinance against road signs around here?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Are we lost? Louis stares out an intersection leading into endless tre

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: No. We’re not lost. (to Rachel) Are we?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: If we don’t like it in Maine do we get to move back to Boston?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Daddy's new job is here, honey.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Think about it, El. Your back yard is going to be a whole forest. Ellie looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Forests are boring. UP AHEAD we see a small market advertising bait and tackl

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s it. Remember that market?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Hang on, everyone. Louis makes the turn onto a narrow two lane road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon cruises down a long stretch of empty ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis rubs his eyes. Gage has fallen asleep. Rachel stare out at big homes set back in the trees. After a BEAT --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So quiet out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good quiet?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Just quiet. He glances over --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Having second thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We could never afford a place like this in Boston. Louis studies her face. That didn’t answer his question.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Daddy! Watch out! The DOG from the opening stands in the road. Louis hits the brakes, screeching to a halt. The creepy d stands in the headlights, unmoving. Its fur is clumped an dirty, eyes red and dark. Just staring into the light.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (quietly) Everyone okay? Ellie and Rachel nod as the dog walks slowly around the c Gage opens his sleepy eyes as the dog pauses, looking at

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Doggie... The dog turns, slipping off into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bye bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crickets so loud it’s almost unnatural. Headlights flicke in the trees as the station wagon creeps up the driveway. Louis parks by a large two-story home with wraparound woo porch and swing. The same house from the opening sequence Rachel pulls Gage out of his seat as Ellie walks to her father, taking his hand, staring up at the stars overhead The night is warm. A light wind. Dark and magical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don’t we have stars like this in Boston.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We do. You just can’t see ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What do you think of the house, El? Ellie walks forward, looking up at the massive house.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: This whole place is ours?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (nodding) Front door should be open. Movers dropped everything off today. Ellie opens the door, standing for a moment in the doorwa Then she takes off running from room to room, switching o lights, her excited voice echoing through empty spaces.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s so big! I love it!! Louis walks with Rachel and Gage into the house as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is partially unpacked, boxes and rugs lying aro Church lies on his favorite cushion in the front window a Louis and Rachel unpack boxes in the living room. Louis prepares to nail a picture hanger into the wall --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t. Gage is napping. Louis leans the picture against the wall, looking around

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Did Ellie finish her room? BEHIND HIM Church stretches and jumps down to the floor. As Rachel and Louis continue talking we drop into --  CAT POV weaving through boxes, down the hallway into the kitchen, across the room to his food bowl. Church pauses, hungrily finishing what’s left in the bowl Back in CAT POV as we slip under the table and out into t hallway. Our POV turns to see a door sitting open. We approach. Church stands at the door, sniffing the damp air. We hear Louis looking for Ellie somewhere in the house.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ellie? Where’d you go? Church pushes the basement door open, slipping down into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT POV as we come down the stairs, slipping under the wo bench and finally crossing to some shelves where we FIND A_ small CUBBY HOLE covered by a faded curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Church pauses. There’s something in there. As he sniffs - TWO HANDS shoot out pulling the cat into the tiny space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE CUBBY Ellie sits curled up and trying not to giggle as she holds Church in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Quiet, okay? We’re hiding. After a BEAT we hear heavy feet coming down the stairs. A shape moves behind the curtain. Two feet are standing the Ellie screams as Louis suddenly pulls the curtain back!

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Found you! He grabs Ellie as she giggles and squirms away.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: No fair! Church gave me away!! Church takes off up the stairs. Ellie follows.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s my special hiding place. Don’t tell anyone, okay?  10. Louis follows them out of the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel works in her vegetable garden, setting up tall sta and strings for her bean plants. Ellie comes around down porch stairs, walking over to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Can I watch a show? I’m bored. Rachel pulls off her gloves, wiping her brow --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why don’t you play outside? It’s so nice out.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (sulking) There’s nothing to do... Her voice drifts off as we HEAR a soft repetitive DRUM BE somewhere. Dry and sad. Ellie and Rachel walk around the side of the house to SEE -- A procession of CHILDREN marching toward the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOMBER BOY in the front pushes a wheelbarrow with a LUM wrapped in a sheet and some pieces of WOOD and a SHOVEL. He is followed by a single file line of children in ANIMA MASKS, walking slowly. At the end of the line, a GIRL ina CAT MASK pounds out the funeral march. Strange and surrea

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Looks like some kind of procession.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: What’s a procession?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Like a parade but not for fun. Ellie walks closer, mesmerized as the strange children ma their way into the trees. The drum beat echoing. The Girl at the end of the line in the Cat Mask glances b at Ellie as she turns up into the woods. Ellie follows, walking to the edge of the lawn where the trail begins.  11. ELLIE'S POV of the hand painted sign reading: PET SEMATAR The same trail we saw in the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie starts up the trail, then stops. There’s something about this place. It’s too dark. Too frightening. A HAND touches Ellie’s shoulder and she jumps. It’s Rache

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Must be a pet cemetery up there...

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (sad) One of their pets died? Rachel can see Ellie’s frightened --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let’s go help daddy. Gage will be waking up from his nap soon. Ellie looks relieved as they turns back. As they walk bac down the trail, she glances over to SEE -- Their NEIGHBOR'S HOUSE peeking through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cottage with gray shingles, smoke rising from a chimney dark and mossy. There’s someone in the window. Ellie looks up, noticing her mother has continued walking She quickly runs to catch up to Rachel as we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Stuffed animals, posters, books. A night light sends purp butterflies across the walls in lazy circles. Ellie lies bed as Rachel and Louis tuck her in. She seems worried.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You okay? Ellie speaks softly, her mind racing with scary thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: When is Church going to die?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Everyone has to die sometime. That’s how life works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even you and mommy? Rachel comes over, sitting on the side of the bed --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're thinking about all this because of that place in the woods? Ellie nods. Louis takes a breath, then launches in --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: When someone dies... even a cat or a doggie... their body goes into the ground but that doesn’t mean they’re gone forever... OFF Ellie’s confused look --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember when Nana passed away and we all flew down to Florida? Ellie nods.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What daddy’s saying is Nana’s body went into the cemetery but her spirit went up to heaven. She’s up there right now. I bet she can even see your new room.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: People in heaven can watch us?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know if it works like that exactly. No one really knows -- Rachel shoots Louis a look and he quickly switches gears.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t need to worry about any of this stuff because Church and me and mommy are going to be around for a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: You promise?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Promise. Louis and Rachel lean in to kiss Ellie good night as we -  13. PUSH past Ellie’s worried face to the dark WOODS outside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. MASTER BEDROOM —- LATER Louis stands in his pajama bottoms brushing his teeth. As spits out and rinses, Rachel comes up behind him --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (imitating him) Everyone has to die sometime, kid. Deal with it! He turns around to face her, a playful smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You're the one who said dead people watch us from the sky. That’s pretty creepy for a kid.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They are! She pushes him over to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do you doctors have such a hard time with spirituality? You really think people are just flesh and bones with no soul?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I’m just injecting an element of reality into her life. Everything you're selling is a fairy tale. A flicker of pain in Rachel’s eyes --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I didn’t mean your sister... Rachel sits on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know what it’s like to lose someone when you’re a kid. I don’t want her thinking about this stuff yet. Let her have the fairy tale. He lies down, pulling her into her arms --  14.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You're right. I’m sorry. Let’s live the fairy tale. Rachel folds into Louis’ chest, kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the Creed home and surrounding woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie stands in the grass, staring at the trail leading u into the woods. She takes a breath, heading up the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie walks past the PET SEMATARY sign, winding up the na trail, heading deeper into the forest. Trees block the light as Ellie grows smaller in the trail disappearing around a corner. Swallowed up by the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie comes to a clearing of grass with tiny GRAVESTONES. She slows down, taking in the sudden presence of death al around her. Each name represents a family pet who died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses by a freshly dug grave. The wooden sign reads: TALULAH. Best dog in the world. June 6, 2016. A dog colla hangs on the sign. This must be the pet from the processi She walks around the rings of graves. Birds, cats and hamsters. She stops at one: Biffer. One Helluva Sniffer. Oct. 1958. The ones in the innermost ring are old and decayed, clumps of grass obscuring the names: SMUCKEY. 19 The wind blows through the trees, catching Ellie’s attent She notices the path through the cemetery stops abruptly pile of branches and trees. Ellie looks for a way around huge pile but it’s blocked by thorny THICKET and BRAMBLE.  15. Someone built a DEADFALL to block the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie reaches for the first limb. It creaks under her weight. She moves higher, branches bending as she makes h way to the top of the pile. Suddenly, a VOICE behind her

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get off of there! Ellie turns and loses her balance. She tumbles backwards the ground, cutting her knee open on a rock as the OLD MA runs up behind her, glancing nervously at the deadfall.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You kids shouldn’t be up here. Ellie touches the blood on her leg, eyes fluttering.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I cut my knee... FADE TO BLACK. BOOTS crunching through underbrush as we FADE IN to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OLD MAN carries Ellie down the trail in his arms. His hands are huge and rough, face hard as if carved from sto Ellie’s head lolls as he walks. Her eyes drift open -- ELLIE'S UPSIDE DOWN POV: the trees bouncing up and down w the movement of his gait. She passes out again.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: The sound of water running as we FADE IN to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie wakes up on a couch in a dark cottage. It smells li cigarettes and stale beer. Water runs in a sink somewhere Ellie sits up, realizing she’s in a stranger’s home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head is still foggy as she looks around at DEAD ANIMA mounted on the walls. Taxidermy. A rifle on the wall. Ellie stands, heart racing. This feels dangerous. Suddenl the OLD MAN appears in the door behind. Ellie spins aroun  16.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Who are you? How did I get in here? The OLD MAN from the pet cemetery steps into filtered lig This is JUD (60's), unflinching, a reclusive hunter with five day beard and some hard years etched in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: You fell off the deadfall. Must have passed out when you saw blood. Ellie takes a step backwards, assessing the threat.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I should get home. My mom... Jud drags an ottoman across the floor with a heavy scratc

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Sit down. Not gonna bite you. Ellie senses something in Jud’s eyes. This guy is shy, no mean. He’s not intimidating. Just _a_sad_ and lonely man. Ellie sits down putting her leg on the ottoman. Jud sits across from her, cleaning the scrape with a warm washclot She watches him as he works, concentrating. After a BEAT

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: What’s your name? Jud ignores her for a BEAT, then --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Eleanor Creed. We just moved here from Boston. Jud nods, glancing up --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Jud.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I saw you in the window the other day. You're our neighbor.  17.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Lived in this house for sixty three years. Seen a lot of people come and go from yours. Jud walks to the bathroom to look for something.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mumbling as he rummages) Kids shouldn't be up in those woods. Not safe up there. Ellie notices a PHOTO on the table nearby and picks one u ANGLE on the photo: Jud in a suit, much younger, standing proudly next to a PRETTY GIRL in a bridal gown. Ellie notices Jud in the doorway holding a Band-Aid.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You make a habit of going through people’s things? Ellie sets the photo down. She studies him a moment, then

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Is that your wife? Jud sits again, unwrapping the Band-Aid. He glances up.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Her name was Norma.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: She’s pretty. Jud busies himself with the Band-Aid. Hiding his sadness.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened to her? Jud looks up. This girl is confounding him.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: She was sick. Passed away.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: She's still here, you know. She's watching us from heaven. Ellie smiles at Jud. A layer of ice melts off his heart.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: That so, Ellie?  18. Ellie nods, jumping up. She walks to the door --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: You want to come and meet my cat? His name is Church. Jud stands up.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: I don’t keep pets. Not around here. Ellie nods to the animals stuffed on the walls --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: You only like to shoot them? Jud sighs, following her to the door --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Fine. I’11l come meet your damn cat if you want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie walks out of the woods with Jud. Rachel looks up fr her garden, surprised to see Ellie with some strange man. She comes over, wiping her hands on her work pants --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: El? Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I fell on a rock. Jud helped me. Ellie points to the Band-Aid. Rachel kneels down.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, sweetie. You okay? Ellie nods. Rachel stands, holding out her hand to Jud.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Crandall, right? Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Most folks just call me Jud. Rachel smiles, trying to break the awkwardness --  19.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, thank you, Jud. It’s nice to meet our neighbors. Ellie grabs Jud’s hand, pulling him toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Come and meet Church. She points to her bedroom window upstairs --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My room’s on the second floor. Our house in Boston didn’t even have a second floor... Jud glances back at Rachel as Ellie tugs him up the porch

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Kid’s like a force of nature.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dining room table is covered in dishes and empty bott of beer and wine from dinner. FLOAT past the mess into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jud sits in a chair as Ellie performs a dance for him. Lo and Rachel sit on the couch with Gage curled on Rachel’s This is Ellie’s favorite thing, spinning through the room free and easy, swooping past her parents to make them lau Jud sips a beer, enjoying the show as Ellie finishes with pirouette. Ellie beams, taking a bow. Everyone claps. Louis starts rummaging in a wooden cabinet --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Want another drink, Jud? Think I have some scotch here somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Better get home while I can still walk. Louis notices Jud’s wedding ring.  20.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Didn't realize you were married. (to Rachel) We should've invited his wife over.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: You can’t dad. She died.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ellie, hey. That’s not polite. Jud waves this idea away, standing up --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Ellie didn’t mean anything by it. He turns to Louis --

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Been a long time since I got to sit with folks and just jaw a little. (to Rachel) And even longer since I had good home cooking like that. Thank you. Louis walks with Jud to the door.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We'll have you over again, Jud. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Jud, wait... Ellie runs over to Jud, giving him a long, spontaneous hu

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good night, Jud.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Good night, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie stands by the kitchen door in her dance clothes.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Come on, mom. I don’t want to be late. Rachel appears with Gage, shouting over her shoulder --  21.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Louis? You coming? Louis arrives in his scrubs, jingling the keys in his han

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Was looking for these. The family rushes outside as Louis reaches back to pull t kitchen door closed. Slamming it a little too hard. The barrier on the cat door slides down with a THUNK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon pulls out of the driveway. Church comes trotting up the driveway to the cat door. He tries to push it open but the barrier is down. Locked out He tries to nudge through but eventually gives up and wal around the house, heading down the path toward Jud’s plac INT. JUD’S HOUSE - DAY Jud stands over his stove frying HASH in a skillet, cigar dangling from his lips. He scrapes the food onto a plate then takes the pan to the sink. As he turns -- Church jumps up into the kitchen window behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jud cleans, Church steps down to the counter, inching closer to the food, taking a bite of the steaming pile. Jud turns to see Church eating his lunch.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Get away from that. Jud waves his hand, shooing Church away but the cat start accidentally knocking the plate onto the floor with a cra

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on! Get out of here. Jud opens the kitchen door, shoving the cat into the driv with his foot. He turns back to the mess on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn scavenger.  22. As he starts to clean up the mess we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classical music plays as a DANCE INSTRUCTOR directs a gro of YOUNG GIRLS through their routine. Rachel sits along t back wall with the other MOMS, bouncing Gage on her leg. MOVE IN on Ellie as she concentrates to stay in time with other girls. The music continues to play as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis holds a chart as he enters an exam room. A STRANGE LOCAL WOMAN sits in a chair, leg in a compression stockin

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Morning, Mrs. Hughes. Wanna tell me what’s going on with that ankle? The woman’s face knits into a grimace of disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HUGHES
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? Never seen you before. Louis slides a chair over, preparing to examine her foot.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That’s because I’m new. My name’s Doctor Louis Creed. I’m taking over for Bill Jacobson. The woman begrudgingly extends her swollen foot.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HUGHES
dialogues.text: About time they put Bill Jacobson out to pasture. Old coot could hardly see past his own nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music still plays but all the other kids have gone home a Ellie continues practicing her routine. Rachel approaches  23.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sweetie, we have to get home. Ellie doesn’t hear her mother, lost in the music, tracing finger through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis comes down the hallway exhausted from a long day. T Nurses run past him the other way.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: A boy got hit by a truck. Louis turns, following them around the corner as -- PARAMEDICS roll a gurney through the door. The YOUNG MAN the gurney is soaked with blood. Half his face scraped aw Louis waves the EMT’s through, falling in beside the gurn

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What do we know?

dialogues.speaker: EMT
dialogues.text: (visibly shaken) His, uh, name is Paskow. Victor Paskow. Got hit by a logging truck up on Lovell Creek Road... Louis leans down to the boy as they walk --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Victor? Can you hear me? The Boy moves his head, his single working eye finding Lo He moves his mouth, trying to speak as blood gurgles out

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR PASKOW
dialogues.text: Don’t want to die...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You're not dying, Victor. Stay with me, okay? Stay with me... They turn a corner into a TREATMENT AREA as the paramedic quickly transfer Victor to the table. A nurse peeks in.  24.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Life Flight is on the way from Bangor. Twenty minutes. Louis nods. That’s too long. He goes back to Victor.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Victor. Listen to me. We’ve got a helicopter on the way. I just need you to stay focused on my voice. Victor tries to speak, his eye wide with fear.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR PASKOW
dialogues.text: I’m dying...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: No, Victor. Just stay with me. (to the nursing staff) We need a hemostat on the femoral artery. Prep two units of blood. There’s a buzz on the machine as Victor’s heart stops.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddammit. He’s coding! Louis immediately begins compressions on Victor’s chest a Victor’s hand shoots out, gripping Louis’ arm. He pulls Louis down toward his gasping mouth. Trying to form words

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR PASKOW
dialogues.text: I can feel it inside me now.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Feel what, Victor? Victor takes a ragged inhale. Eyes locked on Louis.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR PASKOW
dialogues.text: Death. Victor's body seizes up, going rigid as his eyes slip awa Then he softens. His hand loosens its grip. He’s gone. After a BEAT, Louis lifts Victor’s hand away, laying it across the boy’s chest. Louis turns to the Nurse, eyes do

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Mark the time.  25. EXT. JUD’S HOUSE - DRIVEWAY - SAME TIME Church picks himself up in the driveway as we hear Jud cursing and cleaning the mess in his kitchen. We hear a rustling as Church turns to SEE -- That evil Dog from the opening emerges from the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animal looks worse now. Fur clumped up and ragged, he slung low as it moves forward, eyes locked on the cat. Church hisses, backing up. INT. JUD’S HOUSE - SAME TIME Jud dumps a pile of broken plate and food into the trash We hear a loud CAT SQUEAL and a deeper, loud SNARL. Jud goes to the window, looking out -- The Dog has church in his jaws, shaking him wildly.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch!! Jud grabs the broom and races out to -- EXT. JUD’S HOUSE - DRIVEWAY - CONTINUOUS Jud swings the broom at the wild Dog. The Dog jumps out o the way, giving Church a final, deadly shake with his hea CRACK! We hear the SICKENING SNAP of bone breaking as the Dog drops Church, racing off into the trees. ANGLE on Church, blood seeping from puncture wounds. His head flops to the side. Neck broken.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Dammit... Ellie... Jud glances over at the Creed House as we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Rachel sits on the edge of Ellie’s bed. Ellie seems worri  26.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. Church always comes home for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s probably out exploring.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: He shouldn’t be out in those woods.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Shhh, honey. Church will be fine. You need to get some sleep. Ellie lies back. Her mind spinning bad thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Will you keep the lights on in case he’s trying to find us? Rachel gives Ellie a little kiss.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Of course, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis drives down the road, his mind still back in the ER distracted by the trauma of losing Victor Paskow. He absently flicks on his blinker, about to turn up the driveway when we hear a loud HOOOONK! Headlights fill Lou car as he looks up to SEE -- A HUGE 18 WHEELER roaring right toward his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck veers into the shoulder, missing his car by inc Louis watches in the mirror as the huge truck rumbles pas freight train of chrome and dust, disappearing behind him He takes a breath and carefully pulls up the drive to fin Someone standing outside his house in the driveway. It’s Jud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis and Jud stare down at a LUMP on the washing machine  27.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Jesus... what happened? Jud pulls the sheet back to reveal Church, bloody punctur wounds on his side, blood crusted on his nose and mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Wild dog. All kinds of animals in those woods... Louis touches Church’s body. It’s already going stiff.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s my fault. Church had jumped in here and made a mess. I got so steamed, I shoved him out the door. Jud pours two shots from a bottle of whisky. He throws on back, hands shaking. He hands the other to Louis.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Animals out here are scavengers. Bet that old dog had his eye on Church since you guys moved in. Louis tosses his whisky back, taking a moment to think.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What do I tell Ellie? The move has already been so hard for her. This is going to break her heart. Jud watches Louis. An idea brewing in his head.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Louis nods as he pulls the sheet back over the cat.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You mind keeping him here while I go talk to Rachel? She’s better at figuring this stuff out.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Louis heads for the back door, lost in thought --

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Louis, wait...  28. Louis pauses in the doorway, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Yeah? Jud_wants to say something but decides against it.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: It’s nothing. Go be with your family. I’m here if you need me. Louis nods, ducking out the door as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits on the couch wiping tears from her eyes. She looks over at Church's empty cushion, reality sinking in.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, god, Louis. Ellie thinks he’s coming home. Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I saw him myself. His neck is broken. Louis sits next to Rachel as she starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Dammit, Church. Loved that cat... Louis glances at the stairs to make sure Ellie isn’t ther

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (quietly) Maybe we can do a little burial up in that cemetery? Give Ellie a chance to say a proper goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No, I don’t want her to start obsessing about death and dying like I did when I was her age.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: So what do we do? Rachel wipes her tears, formulating a decision --  29.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know... sometimes cats run away when they move. We tell her Church is still out there... She looks up at Louis, eyes pleading --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything but dead. Louis holds her eyes, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it with Jud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis heads back across the lawn, ducking through the tre EXT. JUD’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS As Louis gets close he notices the house is pitch black. comes up the porch, tapping lightly on the windows --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (whispering) Jud? You asleep? No answer. Louis turns, thinking what to do when he SEES A flashlight heading up through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Jud and he’s carrying something over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jud stands amongst the graves, eyes bleary from too much whisky. He sets the HEAVY LUMP in the sheet on the ground and tosses his shovel to the ground. Then he turns -- Taking a couple wobbly steps through the markers as his l comes to rest on the one that reads: BIFFER. Jud sways in the moonlight, taking another slug of whisky

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: (mumbling) There you are.  30. His eyes move up to notice something else -- The DEADFALL across the cemetery lit by the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jud stares at the twisted pile of dead branches, unable t turn away as the wind picks up in the trees. Finally, he kneels down in front of Biffer’s grave, tears on his chee

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn, I miss you, boy... A SHADOW appears behind Jud, growing as it approaches -- Jud_startles, turning to see Louis standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I saw the flashlight. Louis reaches for the bottle in Jud’s hand, taking a swal

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Didn't think I’d make you do this all by yourself, did you? Jud gathers himself, pointing at his dog’s grave.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: That's my dog Biffer right there. Jud’'s gaze drifts to the deadfall again, lost in memory.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Death changes you when you’re a kid. Gets into your bones. Louis takes another swig of whisky, studying Jud’s face.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Let’s get this done. Louis hands the bottle of whisky back to Jud, grabbing th shovel off the ground to dig a hole. As he starts to work Jud takes a step toward the deadfall --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: (softly) I need to see it... Jud picks up the sheet with the cat and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: See what? Jud?  31. Jud ignores him, walking toward the deadfall. Louis follo holding the shovel in his hand as he stumbles in the dark But Jud is already climbing, scrambling over dead branche

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you going? Louis shouts as Jud disappears over the top of the deadfa

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is fine right here! No answer. Jud is gone.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crazy old bastard. Louis starts to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis drops to the ground on the other side. He takes a f cautious steps, shovel still gripped in his hand, scannin the dark trees. There’s nothing. No sign of Jud. Then -- The flicker of Jud’s flashlight. Louis follows.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Jud, wait up! Louis pushes through the trees, losing the trail. It’s pi black as dead branches scrape at his arms. He pauses, noticing something carved into the trunk of a tree -- A primitive SYMBOL. Native and ancient. Foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hell..? LOUIS’ POV blurs for a moment. The symbol on the tree wav as a buzzing sound builds in his head. Under that sound - A whispering in the trees. The sound of voices long dead. Louis pushes forward. There are more symbols now. Differe ones. Carved into the trees like some ancient warning.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Louis pushes over a low rise to FIND --  32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low SWAMP with clumps of GRASS jutting out of the black water. Fog curls as Jud wades out into the shallow marsh.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Jud ignores him, wading into the water. Louis comes to th edge of the bog. He pauses, his vision blurring again. Shadows shift and move. The darkness is alive.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jud, man. Stop. Jud pauses in the water, pointing at something --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Over there. Louis follows Jud’s finger to SEE -- A circular MOUND OF DIRT sticking out of the marsh.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It has to be right there. Jud sloshes up onto the mound of dirt. Louis calls out --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. What is this place? Jud drops the sheet with the cat on the ground, turning b to Louis. The wind swirls with that soft whispering voice

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Can’t you hear that? It’s alive. Louis shakes his head, sloshing out into the bog. He step up onto the mound of dirt, tossing the shovel down. Church’s dead face stares up at him in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bury your cat. Right here.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: This is crazy... Louis turns, stumbling back in the water. Then he stops.  33. The grass rustles around him. Wind whispering. He can’t leave and Jud knows it. This place won’t let him. Louis turns back to see Jud holding out the shovel.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Bury your cat. CLOSE as the shovel slams into the ground. Dirt. Shovel. Dirt. Shovel. Dirt. Shovel. Low and rhythmic like a heartbeat as a hole opens in the ground. Louis slides Church into the hole, pulling dirt over the He tries to wipe it off on his pants as Jud steps into fr Staring down at Louis as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first sign of light in the sky over the sleeping fore A flock of birds suddenly takes flight in the morning sky swirling up and then disappearing over the Creeds’ house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK past muddy shoes and clothes scattered across the floor. SETTLE on Louis’ face sleeping in the bed as -- His eyes open. He sits up on his elbows. No memory of coming home or climbing into bed. He glances over at Rach sound asleep. His hands are still caked with dirt. Louis sits on the edge of the bed, trying to piece his me back together as a HAND reaches out for him. He jumps.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (groggy) Come back. It’s too early...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Can't sleep. Louis gathers his clothes off the floor, stuffing them in the hamper as he walks to the shower. Rachel looks over.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hey, wait. You and Jud take care of everything last night?  34. Louis gets into the shower. The water goes on.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (FROM THE SHOWER)
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s all done. Rachel slides out, walking over to the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (FROM THE SHOWER)
dialogues.text: Nothing. We buried him. That’s it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We still have to talk to Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I know. Rachel watches steam fill the bathroom. Something seems o in Louis’ voice. INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - LATER Ellie sleeps in her bed. The window is open, curtains blowing lightly in the breeze. Louis and Rachel enter.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (whispering to Rachel) Did we leave that open? Louis goes to close it as Ellie wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Morning, sweetie. Ellie looks up at her parents. They seem weirdly serious.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Church, honey. Jud and I went to look for him last night.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Remember how I was telling you how sometimes when cats move to a new home they get the urge to explore?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. He didn’t run away.  35.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Well, we don’t know for sure...

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Yes we do, dad. He was outside my window last night so I let him in. Louis notices CAT PRINTS on the comforter. Thick black mu His bloods turns to ice. It can’t be Church.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Oh, honey. That was a different cat... one of the neighbor’s...

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: No it wasn’t. Look. Ellie points behind him to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s right there. Louis turns to see a silhouette of a CAT in the closet. Sitting quietly in the darkness. Louis walks to the closet, stomach churning. His hand reaches for the closet door, gently pulling it open -- The sliver of light slowly grows to REVEAL -- Church innocently licking his paws. Alive and well.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Can't be... Rachel comes up next to Louis, giving him a “what the fuc look. He shakes his head, completely at a loss, reeling. Louis kneels down, reading the cats collar: CHURCHILL.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Poor guy’s all covered in mud. Louis reaches out for Church, his hand getting closer. Church backs away, his ears going flat, growling low.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Easy. Just want to take a look... Louis tries to reach for Church but the cat hisses, swatt his finger. Louis pulls his hand back.  36.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ouch! Church darts past Louis, running out of the room. Ellie slides out of bed, glaring at her dad.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, dad. Louis puts his finger in his mouth as Ellie runs after he cat. Rachel turns to Louis once she’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You said he was dead?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: He... his neck was broken... Rachel shoots him a look as she goes after Ellie --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good thing you’re not a vet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis stomps through the trees to Jud’s house. UP AHEAD w see Jud chopping wood on a stump behind his cottage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK!! The axe comes down splitting a piece of wood. Jud glances up at Louis, cigarette smoldering in his mout he sets another piece of wood on the stump.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Louis. Louis glances back to his house to see if anyone’s around

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Church is walking around over there like nothing happened! Jud searches Louis’s face. He raises the axe.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: That’s what you wanted, wasn’t it? Louis thinks about this. There’s some truth to that.  37.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That cat was dead, Jud. His body was getting stiff.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Ellie happy he’s back?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Of course she is. She’s thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Then maybe just leave it alone? WHACK!! Wood splits as the axe comes down. Louis stares a Jud for a moment. The conversation appears to be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creed family eats dinner at the table. Rachel feeds Gage peas as Ellie talks about her dance cla

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Today Miss Colette had us do this cool dragon dance where you have to follow the person in front... Ellie continues her story as Louis slowly looks over at - Church on his cushion. Staring back with yellow eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Dragons, Louis. Ellie’s asking you if they’re real or not.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Hmm? No... not real... Rachel glares at Louis, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: It’s okay dad.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, El. I’m tired.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go lay down?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Yeah... okay. Sorry guys.  38. Louis picks up his plate, walking into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis puts his plate in the sink, glancing out to the woo Then he notices something else in the window -- THE REFLECTION of Church sitting on the table behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Church’s image is surrounded by the trees outside, half i shadow. Sinister and evil. Louis turns around. He stares at the cat for a moment, sensing something stra Church just stares back with his yellow eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis goes to the cabinet, taking out a bag of kibble.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Down to eight lives, buddy. Louis pours food in Church’s bowl, jiggling the bag. Church ignores him. Just staring back at Louis.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not hungry? That’s a first. Louis moves closer. He can see the puncture marks on Church's ribs, now scabbed and matted under dirty fur.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) What the hell happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis lies on the bed as Rachel walks past him in her pajamas. She opens a drawer, pulling out a small wooden b

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Maybe he was paralyzed? You said it was his neck.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I said his neck was broken. She comes back to the bed with a JOINT in her hand. She offers it to Louis. He shakes his head --  39.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t tonight. My head. Rachel puts the joint in her side drawer, lying next to h

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You guys were drinking. Maybe Church was in shock or something? Louis rolls onto his stomach, mumbling into the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Didn’t seem like shock. Seemed like dead. Rachel crawls onto Louis’ back to rub his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, Ellie’s happy.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That’s what Jud said. Louis closes his eyes, finally relaxing a little. She lea down close, her hair spilling across his body.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s been a tough month. Your new job and Church. We need to have some fun. Let’s throw a party for Gage’'s birthday. Have our Boston friends come out, my parents..? Louis sighs, flipping over to face her.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I love all of that except the part about your parents. Rachel makes a face, pushing down on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jerk... He pulls her close, kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Stoner. They kiss more passionately now, rolling together on the As it heats up we FLOAT past them to the door to REVEAL - Church sitting in the hallway watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT POV watching Rachel and Louis make love. After a BEAT The POV turns, gliding low and smooth over the floor, dow the hallway and around the corner to a slightly open door CHURCH sits outside Gage’s bedroom, nudging the door open with his nose. INT. GAGE’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Back to CAT POV as Church slinks into the room, looking around, clocking the mobile on the wall, the night light, window, the crib. The POV moves closer to the crib. REVERSE to Church sitting outside the crib. Watching Gage sleep. His tail flicks nervously. Intense and focused. We hear Ellie’s voice from somewhere in the house.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Church? Here, kitty, kitty... Ellie appears in the doorway. We’re back in CAT POV as we turn around to see Ellie tip-toeing closer, looming over

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) There you are, you naughty boy. Ellie leans down, reaching out for us with huge arms as w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon hovers over the Creed House in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Louis sleep with the window open. The breeze f the woods billows the curtain, a piece of paper flutters. As it settles we HEAR -- Those soft voices we heard in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis suddenly opens his eyes in bed. Wide awake. He swallows, trying to assess if he is awake or dreaming.  41. The wind rises and the curtain billows, the paper flutter He shivers, sitting up on his elbows. Something doesn’t f right. The house is too quiet. He glances over --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Rach? Hey, you awake..? No answer from Rachel. She’s sleeping on her side, facing the other way. Louis reaches over, shaking her gently --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you close the window in Ellie’s room? Rach..? Louis shakes her again and she rolls back to REVEAL -- It’s Victor Paskow. White jaw bone gleaming through his shredded face. Louis pushes backwards, getting tangled in the sheets as -- Victor's hand clamps onto his leg.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR PASKOW
dialogues.text: It’s cold, Louis. Cold... Louis screams, shoving himself backwards out of bed. He gasps, sliding away as VICTOR rises up to REVEAL -- It’s only Rachel. She clicks on the light, groggy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Louis looks up at Rachel, unable to speak. Then --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (unsure) I was... I must have been dreaming? Louis thinks about this for a moment. Then he NOTICES -- Church sitting on a chair nearby. Watching him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KITCHEN —- MORNING Louis sits at the breakfast table in his scrubs, eyes ble as Rachel packs his lunch into a thermal carry bag.  42.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (re. Victor) That’s so sad. Why didn’t you tell me what happened?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: The whole thing with Church happened that night. Guess I just tried to put it out of my mind... Rachel comes over, sliding a chair close to him --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Please don’t do that. I need to know what’s going on with you. Louis nods, memories of Victor washing over him --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: He was a kid, Rach. Maybe five or six years older than Ellie. (glancing at her) If we were in Boston, I could have done more. Maybe saved his life.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, honey. You were there for him. Rachel comes closer, hugging Louis tight --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gave him peace...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. WESTERN MAINE MEDICAL CENTER - LOUIS’ OFFICE - DAY Louis eats lunch at his desk in his doctor clothes, chewi his food as he scrolls through SEARCH RESULTS on his lapt ON THE SCREEN we see a map with the words: Mi’kmaq Tribal lands. Louis leans closer. There is a shaded area with a header explaining: Area of Extinction Event (1788). Louis clicks another link and suddenly we SEE -- The SYMBOLS that were carved into the trees. Below each o is a translation: Death. Resurrection. Hunger. Evil. Louis sits back as a charcoal sketch of the LAST TRIBAL C loads on the screen. His eyes are pure black.  43. Louis notices something in the background. He enlarges th images to see that the Chief is surrounded by a marshy bo A mound of dirt peeking out of the black water behind him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie sits with Church in the middle of the floor. She ha towels spread out and some pet grooming supplies.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: What have you been digging in out there? You smell terrible... She reaches for a pet brush and begins to brush out Churc coat. CLOSE as the bristles pull through matted knots. Ellie looks at the brush: big clumps of fur are coming of Church tries to squirm away but Ellie holds him down --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on, Church! There’s something gross in your hair. She tries to brush the cat but Church SPINS and HISSES, swatting her leg with his claws. Ellie screams, jumping b as Church scampers out of the room. She stands, horrified Deep scratches bleeding down her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights through the trees as Louis arrives home from w INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - LATER Ellie lies on her bed as Louis tapes gauze bandages to he legs where she was scratched.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: There you go, honey. All finished. Ellie rolls over, looking up at her father.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Why would he do that? Church has never scratched me before... Louis looks troubled as he stuffs his supplies back into DOCTOR BAG sitting open on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe living way out here is making him wild again. Ellie pulls up her blanket, face clouding up.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe he doesn’t like it here. She rolls over, facing away from him --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neither do I. Louis sits for a BEAT, then --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Stephanie is coming up with her mom and dad to visit for Gage’s party. She could sleep over if you want? Ellie rolls back, looking up at Louis --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (nodding) I don’t see why not. We got all the room in the world. A flicker of anticipation bounces into her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I could show her my new dance. Louis leans down, kissing Ellie on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: She'll love it. Now get some rest. You have school in the morning... Louis kisses Ellie and clicks off the light. He walks to door, leaving it open a crack as he steps out into --  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis stops as he NOTICES -- Church sitting at the end of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis reaches back, closing Ellie’s door all the way unti clicks. He turns toward Church, shooing him with his hand

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (quietly) Get out of here! Church turns and scampers down the stairs as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis drives slowly through the quaint business district. slows, searching for an address and pulls into a non-desc building marked COUNTY RECORDS OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis follows LIONEL HAVERING (70's), administrator of pu records and land deeds for the town of Ludlow. He talks a they walk down a hallway past a number of office doors.

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING
dialogues.text: They've been talking about putting all these old records on computers for years but with all the budget cuts we’ve had...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Our house, 2116 Bear Creek. It runs right up against the woods. Havering pauses as his SECRETARY hears the address. She shares a knowing glance with Havering then looks down. The Old Man opens his office door, waving Louis into -- INT. HAVERING’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Cramped with file cabinets, maps of the Ludlow on the wal stacks of files and papers shoved into messy piles.  46.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You know the specific lot I’m talking about? Havering glances at Louis --

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING
dialogues.text: I know every plot of land in his town... but that one tends to come up in the system more than others. He pulls out a surveyors map from the 1950's, spreading i out across his desk. Louis joins Havering as he points --

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here’s your house. Top of Bear Creek Road. Only other person lives up there is Jud Crandall.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We've met Jud. He’s a nice guy. Havering glances at Louis, a curious look on his face --

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING
dialogues.text: Crabs are nice, too. (beat) When they’ve been steamed. ANGLE on the map as Havering traces out an old boundary l

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All this land including the lot under your house was part of the old Mi’kmag reservation. Wasn't ‘til the early 1900's that it got officially incorporated.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I thought the Mi’kmagq died off in some kind of extinction event?

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING
dialogues.text: Some say they moved north. Some say they got smallpox. All we know for sure is they never came back.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What about the people who had the house before us? The Pearsons.  47.

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING
dialogues.text: Moved away after they lost their son. Bank took over the property and I guess they sold it to you. Louis thinks about this, almost not wanting to know --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: And the people before them? A beat as Havering studies Louis’ face --

dialogues.speaker: HAVERING
dialogues.text: Like I said, that particular lot has changed hands more than a few times. OFF Louis’ face looking down at the map we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel plays with Gage on the rug in the living room. We over to pick up Church sitting behind them on the couch. The tea kettle begins to whistle in the kitchen as Rachel playfully moves a small fuzzy giraffe closer to Gage.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Giraffe voice) Hey mister! You gonna just sit there or play with me? Gage giggles, smiling at the giraffe --

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Play with you!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Giraffe voice) Well, come on then. Get playing! Gage reaches for the toy as the tea kettle whistles loude

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Giraffe voice) Mommy’s going to go make her tea. Gage plays with the giraffe as Rachel slides back and wal off toward the kitchen. As she exits, we hear a soft THUM Church has jumped down and is walking across the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAGE’S POV as the cat moves around him in a slow circle.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Churchie kitty. Gage drops his giraffe and reaches for Church but -- Church grabs the giraffe and slips past Gage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gage stands up, waddling after the cat --

dialogues.speaker: GAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No... my toy! Church runs up the stairs as Gage wanders over, looking u the stairs. Church pauses at the top, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My toy... Gage starts up the stairs as we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MASTER BEDROOM —- MOMENTS LATER Church crosses to the open FRENCH DOORS that lead out to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat jumps up onto a chair and then up to the narrow WOODEN RAILING that runs along the edge of the balcony. Gage appears at the door, brow furrowed. He sees Church o the railing and walks over, climbing onto the chair. Church backs away. Toy still clutched in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: You're bad, Church. My toy... Church drops the toy over the side of the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE as the toy sails down to the PAVING STONES below. Gage screams, upset. He wraps his hands around the railin pulling one knee up, then the other, pulling himself up t THE RAILING. Gage wobbles precariously, staring down at his giraffe on flat stones below. Not noticing as Church inches closer -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nudging his leg! Gage loses his balance, arms spinning as he falls out and Rachel snatches him off the railing!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Gage... oh my god!!! What are you doing up here!!! Rachel’s panic makes Gage cry harder. Rachel clutches her son to her breast, crying with him as she NOTICES -- Church slinking back into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances over the balcony, noticing the toy lying belo OFF her face as she puts this all together we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sobs as Louis consoles her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It happened so fast. I went to make a cup of tea and he was gone.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Shhh. It’s okay. Everyone’s okay. Rachel looks up at Louis, deep fear in her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He must have followed Church up the stairs. I just don’t get it... Louis stares at her for a BEAT, his mind spinning. Then h turns, pulling on his jacket. As he heads for the door --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. JUD’S HOUSE - NIGHT CLOSE on Jud’s face looking at us.  50.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: I was exactly Ellie’s age when Biffer got hit. Guy who did it was drunk. Made me swear not to tell my parents what happened. REVERSE to reveal Louis sitting across from Jud.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He told me he could fix my dog. Said he knew how to bring him back. Louis takes a swallow from a glass of whisky. Transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He took me up to that place, the marsh behind the pet cemetery. Said people around here been using it for years.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Using it for what?

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: To fix the dead. Jud reaches for his whisky as this hangs in the air --

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta understand, Louis... I never thought Church would be any trouble. He was so gentle. Just a big, lazy cat... There’s something more in Jud’s eyes. Something hidden. Jud takes

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What happened with Biffer? a breath. This is hard. He looks at Louis --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: He came back. Just like the man said he would. Was fine for a while, too...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Something had changed. He was mean. Started biting people. Damn dog nearly ripped the tendons out of my mother’s leg. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s when my daddy put him down... for the second time. Louis’ eyes harden, his hands shaking --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That night in the graveyard. You were already planning on going there, weren’t you? A long BEAT, then the truth comes spilling out --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: That place gets inside you. Some part of me always knew I’d go back. I needed to see it again.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That was our cat. He nearly killed Gage today!! Jud looks up, pleading with Louis --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: God, I’m sorry, Louis. I was wrong. The ground up there is sour. It’s sour...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Jesus. What do I do..?

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Whatever killed the Mi’kmaq is still alive. It lives in that swamp. And it’s inside Church now. (beat) You have to kill him, Louis. It’s not safe to have that cat around. OFF Louis’ face we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty and dark. After a BEAT, we SEE -- A CAT SHADOW moving across the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow walks around the room heading for the CAT DOOR The cat door jiggles as Church pushes through. He walks o to the door leading to the rest of the house.  52. But there’s a chair wedged under the knob. Church freezes A figure moves in the shadows behind him. Louis has been sitting in the dark, waiting for Church to come home. He reaches over sliding the barrier on the cat door close Church turns as Louis steps closer, facing off with him.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Game over. CLOSE on Church as he hisses and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis holding the cat to the work bench with one hand in gardening glove as he reaches for a syringe with the othe Church hisses and claws at him. Defiant.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Hold still. Just like going to sleep... Church stops fighting, switching his tactics. He looks up Louis. Frightened. Helpless. Innocent. The syringe quivers in Louis’ hand. He puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dammit. He looks over to see the plastic PET CARRIER in the corne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis winds up a mountainous road, the carrier on the sea next to him. Church watches him through the wire door. Louis drives past mountains and lakes, deep into the Nati Forest. A sign reads: FOREST SERVICE VEHICLES ONLY. Louis kills the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis sets the pet carrier on the road, flipping the door open. Church steps out, looking up at Louis.  53.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Good luck. CLOSE on Church in the middle of the road as Louis walks to the car and drives away. OFF the cat watching him we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars parked along the driveway, people mingling in the ya Kids run around in packs on the lawn, chasing each other. A table decked out with balloons, a cake with a giant num 3 candle. Rachel sips mimosas with GIRLFRIENDS from Bosto Louis sees Ellie sitting off by herself. He crosses the party, sitting next to Ellie on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (to Ellie) Stephanie was looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I know... I just...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You still thinking about Church? She looks up at her dad, nodding with tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got you something so he’1ll never be too far. Louis pulls out a silver necklace with a CAT PENDANT.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: But... it’s Gage’s birthday today.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I know but I thought you could use something, too. Ellie wipes her tears, turning around so her father can c it around her neck. Her fingers move to the silver cat.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I love it, daddy. Thank you. Louis hugs Ellie and then stands up, indicating the party  54.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Now go have some fun, okay? Ellie runs off as we CUT TO -- VARIOUS SHOTS from the party. Ellie and her friend Stepha dancing in the grass, kids playing games in the yard, Lou and Rachel corral everyone around a cake to sing.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Happy birthday to you, Happy birthday to you... Ellie lifts Gage up, holding him so he can reach the cand

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Happy birthday to Gaaa-aage, Happy birthday to you!! Everyone cheers as Gage blows out the candle.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Good lungs on that kid! The kids all jockey for cake as Rachel and Louis pass out plates and pour champagne. Ellie drifts away from the par She stands back away from the group, noticing something through the parked cars. An animal walking in the road. Ellie wanders over to the road. Gage sees her and follows she slides through parked cars, not believing her eyes -- A cat is walking down the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Church? Ellie doesn’t notice Gage as she walks forward in disbeli ELLIE'S POV as heat from the asphalt distorts Church’s im like a hero from an old western as he walks toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Church! BACK IN THE PARTY: Rachel looks around for Gage.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Louis, do you have Gage?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Don’t you have him?  55. Louis looks around. There’s kids everywhere. It’s chaos.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gage? ON THE ROAD: Church is huge in the frame now. He’s been walking for days. Epic. Determined. Evil. Rachel sees Gage by the driveway, slipping through the ca

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Over there. By the road! Louis heads toward the road when a group of KIDS suddenly swarm him, laughing and trying to pull him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMING KIDS
dialogues.text: HE’S THE NEW MONSTER! GET HIM!!! Kids jump on Louis, hanging on his arms and legs.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Guys! I’m not playing monster. Rachel runs across the lawn past Louis, chasing after Gag

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Gage! Out of the road! Church sits in the middle of the road as Ellie approaches

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I knew you’d come home. Rachel hears a DIESEL ENGINE. An 18 WHEELER approaching.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Gage! Stop! But Rachel doesn’t see Ellie and Church down the street. eyes are locked on Gage as he wanders into the road. The truck roars around the bend, gears shifting. Rachel h seconds to act, running for the road.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gaaaaaaage!!! Gage looks back at his mother. The truck is upon him! Rachel takes two more steps then LUNGES in front of the truck, dragging Gage to safety on the other side. As they hit the ground, she rolls over, looking back to SEE --  56. Ellie and Church in the impact zone. The cat darts away b Ellie simply turns, paralyzed as the truck races at her. She thows up her hands, bracing for IMPACT as we -- CUT TO BLACK. A long beat of SILENCE. A church bell begins to toll as w begin to see SPLINTERED FLASHES of the aftermath -- GLONG! Louis running up to Ellie as blood spreads below h GLONG! Flashing lights on kids’ faces, watching in shock. GLONG! Birthday decorations blowing across the lawn. GLONG! Ellie lies face down on a table as a MORTICIAN staples a flap of skin back onto her skull. GLONG! MOURNERS stand around a grave in a local cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Louis stand by the grave holding Gage’s hand. It’s cold. Summer has broken. Fall around the corner. Thi time the image doesn’t fade. Instead, we stay on Rachel a Louis as the MINISTER finishes his eulogy. As he lowers his bible, all eyes turn to Rachel. She step up to a pile of FRESH EARTH, a small shovel sticking out. RACHEL’S POV into the grave. A_kid size coffin below. She reaches for the shovel but can’t bring herself to do Louis’ hand closing around hers. They’1ll do it together. Now looking up from inside the grave as Louis and Rachel scoop a pile of dirt and toss it down into the hole. The dirt lands on us, wiping us to BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long BEAT then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
