dialogues.text: RACHEL’S PARENTS wait in their Mercedes with Gage as Loui loads the bags into the trunk. Rachel approaches behind h and he turns. She’s shattered, eyes red from crying.  57. For a BEAT there’s nothing to say. Then --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I can’t do this, Louis... please... I don’t want to leave you here. Louis holds her close, trying to stay strong.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I have to transfer my patients and close my office. Three days tops. The sun flickers through the trees. Louis squints at Rach

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be by yourself. We can stay with you... Louis glances over at Gage waiting in the car --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: It’s better Gage isn’t here. I’11l come and meet you. He closes the trunk of the car, turning to Rachel. A long BEAT as he moves the hair out of her eyes. They hug again

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (whispering) God, Louis, I miss her so much. Louis holds Rachel tighter, eventually glancing up to SEE Church sitting on the porch in the background. Watching h His blood turns to ice. He pulls out of the hug.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Better get going. Your parents don’t like to drive in the dark. Rachel gets in the car as Rachel’s father backs down the driveway. Louis waves at Gage until they’re out of sight Then he turns to face the house. And that cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis comes around the side of the house. He’s carrying a white garbage bag with a CAT SIZED LUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis shoves the bag into the trash bin and drops the lid He turns and walks away. Numb. As he comes around the fro of the house, he pauses... looking out to the woods... LOUIS POV of the trail leading up to the cemetery and bey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes that thought away walking quickly inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis sits in front of a plate of untouched food. His kne bouncing up and down nervously, lost in thought. He pushes the food away, going to the cabinet and pulling down a bottle of whisky. INT. JUD’S HOUSE - NIGHT Footsteps on the porch. The door swings open to REVEAL -- Louis standing there, poison thoughts stirring in his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out a bottle of scotch.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I could use some company. Jud goes to fetch a couple glasses. He drops ice into the and comes back, setting them on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Saw Rachel leave earlier. Imagine she took Gage with her? Louis pours two stiff whiskies. Jud takes his and sits ba in his chair, firing up a cigarette. Louis nods.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Boston. Her parent’s house.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: What about the cat?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I took care of it. Jud watches Louis for a moment, drinking his whisky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branches sway. Moonlight piercing the canopy from above. We see Louis and Jud talking through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. Ashtray full. Louis on the couch, watchi as Jud tries to stamp out his cigarette. He’s drunk.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: This is my fault. I should never have shown you that place... Louis looks down, barely able to hear those words.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We both had a hand in it.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Grief poisons a man. It makes you do things... Louis watches Jud. The old man is slurring now, delirious

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It won’t stop now. It used Church to get to Ellie. It wants more. Jud looks up at Louis, suddenly focused, eyes wet with te

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Louis. Ellie was the first person to touch my heart ina a long time. I didn’t want to see her go through all that pain... The glass slips from Jud’s hand, falling to the rug.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dammit... Jud tries to stand up, losing balance. Louis comes over.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Take it easy. I’11 clean this up.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Just need to close my eyes. Louis stands over Jud, looking down as he passes out, the  60. Thump, thump, thump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of tires as LANE MARKERS whiz below us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis drives through town, face dark and determined. On the seat we see a bunch of ROPE, two SHOVELS, a plasti TARP, a BUCKET. The bottle of whisky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis drives slowly past the FUNERAL HOME where we saw Ellie's service, following the brick wall around to the b He shuts off the engine and lights, coasting quietly to a stop by the WROUGHT IRON GATES of the rear service entran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tarp wrapped around tools hits the ground with a THUD. A moment later, Louis drops to the ground. He stands up, wiping dirt of his torn pants. As he starts to collect hi tools, we hear a CAR approaching. He turns to SEE -- A POLICE CAR making rounds. Louis quickly grabs his tools, diving behind a pair of headstones. He rolls onto his back, holding his breath. The police car slows outside the gate, using a SEARCHLIGH scan the lock and the chains. The light sweeps just over Louis’ head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he notices his SHOVEL lying out in the open grass. As the light swings away, he reaches out and pulls the sh out of sight. The light swings back. It holds for a BEAT Then the police car moves on.  61. Louis gets up on his knees, watching as the police car ro around the corner. He quickly gathers his tools and ducks into the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A headstone by a freshly dug grave: May 9, 2006 - July 19 2016. Eleanor Rose Creed. Our beloved daughter. Louis drops his tools, staring at the name. The gruesome nature of his task sinking in. He leans on a nearby tree vomits. Then he unfolds the tarp and picks up a shovel -- And starts to dig. VARIOUS SHOTS of Louis digging. Shovel hitting ground. Ba breaking work. Dripping with sweat. The hole goes deeper. He’s waist deep now using the bucket to bring the soil up LATER Louis is deep in the hole. We can only see the top Louis’ head and the occasional shovel moving. More dirt. THUD! The dull, hollow sound of wood. Louis clears away soil from around the lid of the casket and slides the tip the shovel into the seam. He leans down -- CRAAAACK!!! Wood creaks and groans, starting to give way. CASKET POV looking up as the casket opens to REVEAL -- Louis standing over us. A length of rope in his hand. He stares down, emotions washing over him as he whispers --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Just going to slide this rope around your chest... gonna get you out of here... take you home... As he voice fades we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis crosses the lawn with Ellie’s body slung across his arms. As he ducks through the trees, he looks at over at JUD'S HOUSE. A single light in the window. No movement. Jud_is still passed out. Louis slips up the trail, disappearing into the woods.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis hikes up the dark trail, cradling Ellie’s body as h walks. He passes under the PET SEMATARY sign, heading dee into the woods. Determined. Possessed. As he passes some trees we catch a quick GLIMPSE of -- A PERSON standing in the shadows. Watching him. Louis doesn’t notice as he continues up the dark trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis steps out into the pet cemetery, thin shafts of moonlight illuminating the tilted markers and stones. He still holds Ellie in his arms, her dress spilling out his hands, legs bouncing stiffly as he walks. Louis approaches the DEADFALL, pausing to shift Ellie’s b in his hands as he prepares to climb the pile of branches

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR PASKOW, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop, Louis... this is wrong... Louis pauses. Sensing the presence in the cemetery. He turns, squinting into the darkness. Mist curls around the stones. There’s no one there. Louis takes a breath, collecting himself. He’s exhausted. Finally, he turns back to the deadfall into -- Victor Paskow blocking his way. Face still wet with blood Louis stumbles back, nearly tripping over a grave marker.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Get away from me!!! As his voice rings out he looks again. Victor is gone.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly to himself) You're not even real... Louis looks down at Ellie’s face in the moonlight. She’s beautiful and innocent. Even in this horrible state. He approaches the deadfall again and begins to climb.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis stumbles into frame, coming to the edge of the wate with Ellie’s body in his arms. He stands for a moment, a silhouette against the black water. Staring out at -- The mound of dirt peeking up through the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis pushes out into the water, wading over to the groun the center of the bog. As he lays Ellie’s body down -- We hear the WHISPERING VOICES in the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voices rise, swirling like the wind in shifting layer ANGLE on Ellie’s face. Eyes closed in the moonlight. Louis reaches for a stone on the ground, slamming it into dirt. CLOSE as he digs, rips, pulls away dirt. Obsessed. As he digs we WIDEN to REVEAL -- The wild dog from the opening on the shore of the marsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching Louis dig with its pure black eyes. LATER. Louis sits over a shallow grave. Hands black with dirt. As he turns to pull Ellie’s body into the hole he SEES -- Her eyes are open now. Staring right at him. The VOICES are louder now. Powerful. Growing urgent as -- Louis quickly drags Ellie into the shallow grave.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, baby... Ellie's feet disappear, her legs, her dress, her hands.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry... Louis pulls the last of the dirt over Ellie’s face. The voices suddenly stop. Louis turns away from the grave ashamed and sick to his stomach in the horrible silence. Then his face changes. What has he just done? He drops to his knees, pulling the loose dirt away --  64.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, Ellie... no, no! I’m sorry.. But there’s nothing there. Ellie’s body is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MASTER BEDROOM — MORNING HOT WATER pounds Louis as he sits on the floor of the sho He’s been there for hours trying to scrub the black dirt his hands. A phone rings somewhere in the house. Louis ignores it. In the background we HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (ON MACHINE)
dialogues.text: Louis, hey it’s me. Please pick up. I really need to talk to you. (beat) Shit, okay. I’11 try you at the clinic. Just call me when you can. Louis looks up, eyes vacant. A worm of fear in his stomac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis busies himself in the yard, picking up the kid’s to He glances over at the woods. LOUIS’ POV of that trail leading up into the trees. There’s no sign of movement. No sign of Ellie. He goes back inside. INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - DAY Louis pushes the door open and steps inside. He hasn’t be in here since Ellie’s death. It’s dark and musty. He opens the shades and cracks the window. He strips the and puts on new sheets. He arranges her stuffed animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis shoves his muddy clothes in the trash. He looks dow The bag with Church’s body is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we hear a SOUND nearby, something moving through the trees. Louis walks slowly around the side of the house -- There’s nothing. Just trees and shadows. He seems deflate When he turns back around -- JUD IS STANDING BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: What time you leave last night? I must’ve passed out... Louis closes the garbage bin to conceal his muddy clothes

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know, around midnight... Jud notices Louis’ hands. Raw_and blistered from digging.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Wanna play some cards? I could cook something on the grill. Louis slides his hands into his pockets, moving to the do

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Maybe tomorrow. I need to start packing...

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: I'll bring some food over. You're gonna have to take a break... Louis slips back into the house --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Jud. Rachel left me plenty of food. OFF Jud’s face, watching as the door closes we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis sits at the table, talking to Rachel on the phone -

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Has he been asking about Ellie? (beat, he sighs) House is almost done. Still have to finish up at the clinic...  66. A DOOR creaks somewhere in the house. Louis looks up.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Rachel... hang on a minute... Louis peeks into the hallway, holding the phone in his ha The house is dark and quiet. He walks down the hallway into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis stands in the middle of the room. We can hear Rache still talking on the other end as he looks around. There’s a soft tapping noise. He turns around to SEE -- The front door is open. The screen tapping in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Rach, sorry. I think Jud is coming over. Let me call you in the morning. I will. Love you, too. Louis hangs up the phone, setting it down. He walks towar the front door, peering out the window at the empty yard. He opens the door, stepping out onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood creaks under his weight, moths flutter around the li Louis comes down onto the grass, standing for a moment in yard. The screen door taps behind him in the wind. Louis shivers, his mind playing tricks. Still nothing the As he comes back up the porch, Louis freezes on the top s ELLIE'S MUD COVERED SHOES SIT BY THE FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis steps closer, barely able to breathe. The shoes Ellie was buried in. Thick with black mud. There’s a small muddy HAND PRINT on the wall by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis pulls the screen door open, stepping back into --  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis steps into the room. Empty spaces and shadows sudde feel huge, the silence filled with tension and dread. We hear a creak on the ceiling and he looks at the stairs

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (barely audible) El? Louis starts up the stairs, pausing at the top. The hallw is dark and long. Ellie’s door hangs open -- A light spills out of her room. The purple night light. Then something moves. A SHADOW fluttering inside the room Louis comes down the hallway, heart pounding. The shadow inside the room twists and turns as he reaches for the do Louis approaches the door, pulling it open to SEE -- INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS The night light on. Purple butterflies float across the wall. Both windows are open, curtains fluttering in the breeze. That’s what was making the shadow. Louis walks across the room, closing the windows. Then he pauses, sensing something behind him in the closet -- The same closet where Church hid when he first returned. Louis walks over, hand pulling the door open to REVEAL -- Nothing inside but Ellie’s clothes and toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the room, thinking, nerves tense. There’s something under the bed. A dark shadow. He comes over to the bed, slowly lifting up the skirt to SEE -- A rumpled white dress caked in mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis pulls Ellie’s dress out, unfolding it in his hands. Lace ripped and stained with black muddy dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stares down in shock at the dress we HEAR -- BARE FEET running down the hall.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis comes out of door, looking around. The hall is empt

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Ellie? She's playing a game. He steps out, heading down the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND reaches inside, clicking on the overhead light. Lo looks into the darkness, terrified of what he might find. The bulb overhead makes his shadow long as he comes down stairs. He peeks under the work bench. Nothing there. He turns to the CUBBY HOLE. Ellie’s secret hiding place. Louis comes over, kneeling down. He reaches out, taking h of the small curtain, hands shaking as he pulls it open - The cubby is empty. Louis deflates again. Is this real? Is he losing his mind As he sits back up we NOTICE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head is lowered, looking out of the top of her eyes, caked with dried black mud, hair hanging in stringy clump RACK FOCUS to bring her into focus. Eyes glued to Louis. Louis doesn’t see her. He’s too absorbed in disappointmen as she rises up to standing, coming closer, reaching out tiny mud caked fingers, hand coming to rest on his should

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Daddy. Louis screams, spinning around. He slides backwards acros the floor, breathing rapidly, terrified. Staring at Ellie But she’s shivering. Her body cold. Terrified _and_ confu

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where am I? Louis’ terror melts away, his father instincts kicking in he goes to Ellie, wrapping his arms around her.  69.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You’re home, baby. CLOSE on Louis’ face, holding Ellie tight --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie sits in the tub, knees sticking out of dark grey wa with pieces of SWAMP GRASS floating around her.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Tilt your head back. She does. Louis gently pours water over her head, careful not to get it in her eyes. She looks straight ahead. Louis brushes out Ellie’s hair, pulling gently down throu heavy strands. Ellie winces as he gets caught on a tangle

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Ouch. Louis notices clumps of hair in the brush. He pulls them and drops them in the wastebasket, going back to brushing Ellie winces again --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Sorry. Mom usually does this. He pulls the brush away from her head. There’s something under the hair he keeps getting snagged on -- Louis uses his fingers to slide her hair aside to REVEAL MORTICIAN’S STAPLES holding the back of her scalp down. Louis closes his eyes, turning away. He lets the hair fal back over the wound. Ellie looks up in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: What is it? Louis swallows, pushing the horrific truth away.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Just a tangle.  70. INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Ellie lies in her bed, covers pulled up as Louis turns do the lights. She shivers, scared. Louis sits with her.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What is it, honey?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Church is gone. Isn’t he? She watches his face, searching for the truth --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (lying) The truck in the road hit him. Ellie sits up, eyes locked on Louis --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: No, it didn’t. The truck hit me. Louis freezes. Ellie’s eyes clear and dark. Focused on hi

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Church is dead, honey. I’m sorry. Louis gets up to turn down the light. Behind him we HEAR

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (soft whisper) So am I. Louis spins around. Did he just hear that correctly? Ellie looks up at him with huge, sorrowful eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I sleep with you tonight? I’m scared. Louis swallows, blood going cold. He nods slowly --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Of course, honey. Come on... A flicker of a sinister smile in Ellie’s eyes as she slid out of bed, reaching for Louis’ hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis lies in bed, staring at the ceiling. Ellie lies fac him, curled up under the covers. She reaches out with her finger, tracing it across his face. He can barely breathe

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Where’s mommy and Gage? Louis glances over at her --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: They went to Grandma and grandpa’s for a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: When are they coming back? She watches his eyes. Searching his face for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: A couple more days... Ellie keeps her eyes on him. He's hiding something.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Does mommy know what you did?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Shh, baby. It’s late. Time to sleep. Louis reaches over and clicks off the light. As he lies b on his pillow, Ellie has moved closer. Inches from his fa

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Love you, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (terrified) Love you too, El. Louis closes his eyes, praying for sleep to take him. MOVE IN on Ellie’s face, lying in the darkness, eyes open Staring at Louis in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gage’s tricycle sits in the driveway, grass slick with de  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis wakes up in bed with a start. He rolls over but Ell is gone. He looks around the bed, heart skipping a beat.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Ellie??? Then we hear something. Music on the stereo downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis comes down the stairs in disbelief. Ellie is there she’s doing what she loves most. She’s dancing. Louis comes into the room, watching as she gets lost in t graceful joy of the dance. Spins around. Alive and free. It’s beautiful, sweet, tender, gentle. Tears flow down Louis’ face but he’s not sad. His heart is full again. Ellie sees him and smiles. Spinning faster and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Careful, sweetie... Ellie lets out an excited yell as she twirls past Louis. Now her movements are too fast. Aggressive and dangerous, striking the wall, kicking over a chair.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ellie, stop it! Stop! But she can’t. She won’t. She’s out of control. Louis tries to grab her but she bites his arm and ducks a Running past Louis and down the hallway, out into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie bursts out of the house, laughing and breathing har She pauses for a moment, feeling the sun on her face. It’ glorious. Louis appears in the doorway, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Ellie! Dammit! Get back inside. Ellie’s face sharpens, her eyes convicting him --  73.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: No! I like it out here. Louis runs after Ellie but she takes off around the house

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Ellie... come back!! Louis dives for her but she ducks away, sprinting around garbage bins and down the side of the house to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie swoops across the open lawn with her arms outstretc like an airplane as Louis comes running up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Can’t catch me! She turns backwards, mocking Louis as she comes around th corner of the house and bumps into -- Jud_standing in the path. Ellie stops, looking up at him as Louis comes up behind, panting. Jud stares down in horror at Ellie. In shock.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (playful) Hi, Jud! She moves to hug him. Jud steps back. He doesn’t trust he

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Ellie. Jud looks up at Louis. His secret exposed.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (sharp, to Ellie) Get back inside. Ellie looks from her father to Jud. Then she turns, walki casually over to the house, lingering in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Can’t I just stand right here?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: No. Inside. Now. Ellie sticks her tongue out at Louis and goes inside.  74. Jud turns to Louis, fuming behind his cold eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: What everyone else does. You’re supposed to suffer. ELLIE peeks through the curtain, watching Louis and Jud.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: You couldn’t even put Church down --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (angry) None of this would’ve happened if you hadn’t shown me that place!!! Jud drops his eyes. He knows this is true.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: I couldn't stop myself... that place gets into your blood... He looks up at Louis, determined --

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) She's gonna go bad. Just like Biffer did. Just like Church.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do? I just wanted to tuck her into bed one more time, kiss her goodnight... Louis hands his head, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Ellie’s not a cat, Louis. She’s dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: She’s my daughter. ELLIE'S POV: listening and watching as Jud speaks --

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Not anymore.  75. Jud turns and walks back to his house. After a BEAT, Loui reaches for the door, heading inside as --

dialogues.speaker: BOO
dialogues.text: Ellie jumps out from behind the door, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Jesus, El. Please don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Try and find me! Ellie runs away as Louis steps inside and closes the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie sits on the couch, watching quietly as Louis begins packing up the house into boxes. We see his DOCTOR BAG sitting on the table.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Why are you packing up? Louis stops packing for a moment, glancing over --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We're going back to Boston for a little while. Ellie watches him closely. Searching for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: All of us? Louis looks her straight in the face --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Yes. All of us. A BEAT while this lie hangs in the room. Then -- The phone rings. Louis glances at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s mommy. Ellie gets up, coming closer --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, can I talk to her?  76. Louis steps back, holding the phone away from Ellie --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Not quite yet, okay? I don’t think she’s ready. Ellie pouts, standing just behind Louis as he answers --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rachel, hi. How are you guys? MOVE in on Ellie’s face listening as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits in her parents’ home. THROUGH THE WINDOW we s her MOTHER and FATHER playing with Gage in the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I was getting worried. You've haven't been calling me back.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Been busy with the house. Something is off in Louis’ voice.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don’t keep things from me. If you're having a hard time, I should be there with you. Louis glances at Ellie, lowering his voice --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I just need some space right now.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: God, Louis. Why do you do this? Gage misses you. I miss you. Louis closes his eyes, tears streaming down his cheeks --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I miss you, too.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m bringing Gage back for the weekend. He’ll cheer you up.  77.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: No, Rach. Don’t do that. MOVE in on Ellie standing just behind her dad. She smiles

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Stop arguing. We’re coming out tomorrow. Just for a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie in her pajamas sitting in front of a bowl of cereal Louis sits across from her, watching as she lifts the spo to her mouth. Food tastes strange to her now. Foreign. She sets the spoon down, pushing the bowl away.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Not hungry. Louis nods, taking the bowl to the sink. He pauses for a moment, looking out at the trees. Then he NOTICES -- Ellie standing behind him in the reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like Church did that first night he came back.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you and Jud talk about? Louis turns, facing Ellie. She moves closer, watching him

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: He was just surprised to see you back, is all...

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I can tell when you lie. Louis looks over at her. What else does she know?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: It’s nothing. He’s just concerned. Ellie moves closer, staring up at him. Louis can’t move b any further, body pressing up against the sink. Then Ellie holds out her hand with a creepy smile.  78.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Can we go to bed now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis sleeps in the bed as wind rattles the windows. PAN over to SEE -- Ellie watching him in the darkness. After a BEAT -- She quietly slips out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie stands in front of her father’s medical bag on the table. Her hand slips inside, feeling for something. CLOSE as she pulls out his shining SCALPEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours down through the trees, hitting the leaves in heavy wet drops. We hear something moving in the woods as Jud steps into frame. His huge body in silhouette, watchi the Creed House through the trees. Jud moves closer, moving a branch to get a better look -- A light is on in Ellie’s room. The window open, curtains billowing in the wind. After a BEAT they settle, revealin Ellie standing in the window. Looking out at the woods. H eyes are closed, head tilted slightly back. Jud moves closer, pulling a branch aside to see better. The curtains billow again, blocking our view of Ellie. As the wind settles she comes back into view and we SEE -- SHE’S LOOKING RIGHT AT US! Jud pulls back into the trees, heart racing. Rain comes d around him as he builds the courage to look again -- This time, Ellie is gone. The window is empty. Jud turns back, heading for his house.  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie comes out the front door. Looking around. She steps slowly down the stairs, walking out into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie crosses the grass. There’s something in her hand. The moonlight hits the tiny SCALPEL, glinting in the ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie sneaks through the trees toward Jud’s house. She pauses, seeing a light in the window. As she moves closer Jud_lunges out of the bushes, trying to grab her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie swings the knife, slicing Jud’s hand. He slips backwards as she scampers away into the woods. Jud pulls himself up, reaching for his light. JUD’S POV of the dark woods. Ellie is nowhere to be found

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jud comes around the front of his house to SEE -- The front door is open. He comes up the wooden steps, pausing at the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Ellie. Come on out of there. FOLLOW as Jud walks slowly through the door into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jud stands in the dark room, eyes adjusting to the light. listens to the empty room, taxidermy staring silently at As he crosses to the kitchen we catch a GLIMPSE of -- Ellie passing across a doorway behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jud spins around, heart pounding.  80.

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: Dammit, Ellie. Just come out. Jud walks to a drawer, reaching in to pull out a REVOLVER He clicks it open to check the bullets. It’s full. He fli the chamber closed, walking to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just want to talk to you. No answer from the house. He moves through a door into a long, dark hallway leading to his bathroom and bedroom. Jud stands in the hallway for a beat. His bedroom door is open. He takes a few cautious steps, gun held out.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you’re scared. I’m scared, too. Jud moves down the hallway to the bathroom. He holds the with one hand as he slowly turns the knob with the other Pushing the door open and sweeping the gun around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom is empty. Just a toilet, empty bath, sink. Jud backs up, continuing down the hallway to his bedroom. He taps the door with his foot and it swings open slowly a horrible creak. He inches forward into the room -- The bedroom is empty. Moonlight filtering through curtain Jud moves around the bed to the closet. He opens it to SE Nothing but old clothes hanging there. He peeks behind th He turns, walking past the bed as we DRIFT DOWN to reveal Ellie under the bed. Gleaming SCALPEL clutched in her han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She screams, swinging her hand out with the blade and -- Slicing Jud’s ACHILLES TENDON. Jud screams, falling to the ground. He rolls over on his side to see Ellie sliding backwards under the bed and aim BAM! BAM!! Jud fires two shots under the bed but Ellie is gone. He moans, his leg bleeding badly as he tries to pul himself up but his foot won’t support his weight.  81. Jud rolls onto his back, taking a breath --

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on out, Ellie. Where are you? He pushes himself up with one hand, craning his head to l around the dark room. No sign of Ellie anywhere. He rolls onto his knees, sitting up higher as we NOTICE - Ellie crouched on the dresser behind him like a FERAL CAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jud freezes, sensing Ellie’s presence -- CLOSE on his hand: silently cocking his revolver. Ellie screams, leaping from the dresser into the air -- The knife flashing in the light as Jud spins and fires!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet hits a photo on the wall, shattering the glass Ellie lands on Jud, knocking him to the ground and SLAMMI The scalpel into his chest. Jud gasps, grabbing Ellie with his hands, holding her bac

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (struggling) I thought we were friends?

dialogues.speaker: JUD
dialogues.text: I was friends with Ellie. Not you. Ellie smiles at Jud. Her eyes have gone PURE BLACK. Evil like that black swamp water.

dialogues.speaker: JUD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let your parents live. Ellie's death was punishment enough... Ellie reaches down, forcing the revolver in Jud’s hand to point back under his chin.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: You don’t know what punishment is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. JUD’'S HOUSE - SAME TIME A muffled pop from inside the house as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis asleep in the bed. His bedroom door swings open to reveal Ellie standing in the doorway. Just a silhouette. Then she steps into the room and we see she’s returned to normal. Her eyes are clear. Just an innocent little girl. She walks to the edge of the bed, standing over Louis to watch him sleep. He seems so defenseless. Vulnerable. For a horrible BEAT we wonder what she’s about to do -- Then Louis wakes up. He sits, startled to see Ellie there

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: El, you okay? She drops her eyes, pouting a little.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I had a nightmare. Louis pulls the covers back. Ellie slides into the bed.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (groggy) You're okay. Just a dream.. As Louis falls asleep we TRACK in on Ellie lying in his a staring out the window at the rain falling outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has passed. Water drips through heavy leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis wakes up to the sound of tires rolling over gravel. He slides out of bed, walking to the window to SEE -- Rachel pulling up the driveway in her father’s car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie sits up behind him in the bed. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Mommy’s home. Louis comes to Ellie, pleading with his eyes. He knows th she’s the one in control.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Maybe you can give her a little time to get adjusted before. .?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you think she’1ll be happy to see me? Something in Louis melts. He still sees her as his daught

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Of course, honey. It’s just, it’s going to take some time.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe I should hide? Like a game? Louis gets the chills. This doesn’t feel like a game to h

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Okay, great. I’11 go talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis comes slowly down the stairs as we HEAR -- Footsteps on the porch. The front door opens and Gage bur inside, running up to his father.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Daddy, daddy, daddy!!! Louis scoops Gage into his arms, hugging his son.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I missed you so much. Wait a second, did you get bigger? Gage squeals with laughter as his dad lifts him up and do Then Louis notices Rachel in the doorway. He sets Gage do

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Hi. They come together, hugging. This is the first time in da that Louis has felt fully alive. He doesn’t want to let g

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, babe. I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I missed you, too. Rachel walks into the house. She pauses, looking around. Nothing has been packed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What happened? I thought you’d been packing this whole time?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: It was hard, Rach... Rach moves around seeing Ellie’s sneakers by the wall, he scooter by the door, her sweatshirt on a chair. She shakes her head, looking back at Louis --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you doing? This is all Ellie’s stuff. Gage walks to the stairs as a SHADOW appears on the wall. But Rachel is absorbed with Louis, deeply concerned --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you doing this on purpose? Trying to punish yourself? ON THE STAIRS Ellie moves into view. She puts her finger her lips indicating for Gage to be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Mommy ! Rachel doesn’t respond. She’s staring at Louis. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Rach, it’s not like that --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: This is why I wanted to leave. How do we explain this to Gage?  85. Gage is tugging on his mother’s shirt now, pointing at something. Rachel looks down at him --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it, honey?

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Ellie. Ellie. Ellie-phant!

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (softly) Don’t call me that. Rachel looks over in shock as Ellie steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel screams, pushing herself backwards along the floor until she hits the wall. She’s going into shock.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: See, mommy? Ellie! Rachel gasps, trying to form words. She looks to Louis --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: How this is happening..?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That place behind the Pet Cemetery where Jud and I buried Church... it’s a special place, Rach. It has power. Rachel glances at Ellie in horror, then back to Louis --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don't... this can’t be real...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: It’s real. It worked with Church, too. It brings things back. Ellie stands in front of Rachel now. Looking down at her mother, majestic and powerful. Somehow alive and dead. Rachel looks at Louis, fear turning to dread --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You moved her body? You took her into the woods?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Of course, I did. How could I not, knowing it would bring her back?  86. Ellie reaches out for her mother. A moan slips out of Rachel’s mouth as Ellie’s hand traces across her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Aren’t you happy, mom? I missed you. Rachel turns to her dead daughter, voice trembling --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I missed you, too. Rachel stiffens as Ellie moves in to hug her. It’s horrib and awkward. But it’s also her daughter so something melt Gage comes over, trying to soothe his mother, hugging bot Rachel and Ellie. This makes Rachel cry and hug them both Finally, Louis kneels down, wrapping his arms around them The family reunited. As the family hug continues we come around to Ellie’s fac looking over her mother’s shoulder to the dark woods outs Ellie smiles. Her eyes pure black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits on the lid of the toilet, eyes red from cryin We hear Louis knock softly, his voice through the door.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Rachel? Can I come in? The door opens and Louis slips inside, looking down at he

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (terrified) I don’t understand. What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. She’s back.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It matters to me. You can’t just say there’s some place in the woods. That’s not good enough! !  87. Louis glances into the hallway, pulling the door closed -

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Shhh, okay. Keep your voice down. Louis sits on the edge of the bathtub, taking a deep brea

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s been like this for hundreds of years. That place has power. As he continues to explain we CUT OUTSIDE THE DOOR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find Ellie standing in the shadows, listening to her parents’ voices through the crack in the doorway. After a BEAT, she backs away, turning down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gage eats a cookie as Ellie approaches him from behind.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Want to play a game, Gage?

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Turn around. Gage turns around, obeying his sister. She takes a cloth napkin and ties it over his eyes like a bandana.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t like being gone. I like being with you and mom and dad. Gage holds out his hands nervously, trying to balance --

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: I can’t see.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: That’s how the game works. It’s called Marco Polo. Every time you say Marco, I say Polo and then you try to find me. Understand?  88. Gage nods as she steps back. He turns, feeling for her.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Marco. Ellie steps back as Gage takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Polo. GAGE’'S POV from behind the blindfold: we can only see a slice of the room at the top and bottom of the frame.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Marco.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (further away) Polo. Gage moves into the room, feeling with his hands as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel has stopped crying now, leaning close to Louis --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You were supposed to be the strong one. A medical doctor. You see death all the time...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: It was different with Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: She's changed, Louis. Her skin. I want to remember her like before. Louis sighs closing his eyes. He knows she’s right.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not just that. Remember what happened with Church. We need to think about Gage. He needs you. This makes Rachel think of something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie slides backwards around the dining room table as he brother comes into the room, his hands out, feeling his w She has her father’s scalpel in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Marco. Ellie jumps out of the way, dropping the scalpel on the ground. Gage turns, hearing the noise. Gage turns around, waving his hands.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marco? GAGE’S POV inside the blindfold: we see Ellie reaching fo something on the ground. She doesn’t answer Gage’s call.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marco. Marco? An excruciating BEAT inside the blindfold. Then, finally

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Polo. Ellie is right in front of him. Gage pulls his blindfold

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Got you! Ellie smiles at him. Her hand hidden behind her back. Then her eyes move to something else -- Rachel coming down the stairs. She walks quickly over to Gage, gently pulling him back from Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let’s play outside. Get some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie plays with Gage on the lawn, chasing and giggling a they roll around in the grass. BEHIND THEM -- Rachel watches from the porch. Her face is blank. Numb.  90. Louis comes out, sitting next to her. After a BEAT --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We'll do it tonight. After dinner. She glances over at him, a glimmer of hope in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was wrong... I’m so sorry... His eyes tear up. Rachel pulls him close, hugging him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Shhh, okay... it’s gonna be okay. Ellie turns away from Gage on the lawn. Listening to them

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) We'll do it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gage carries silverware behind Louis, carefully placing a fork on each folded napkin as Louis lays out the plates.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That’s it, Gage. One fork for everyone. Ellie enters with a bowl of spaghetti and red sauce.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Bas-getti! Gage tries to reach into the bowl, Ellie lifts it away --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Careful, Gage... it’s hot... Everyone takes their seats.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Should we do our thankful fors? Louis nods at Ellie as they all hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I’m thankful mommy and Gage came home.  91. She smiles at Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: I’m thankful for bas-getti!

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I’m thankful we’re all together. They all look at Rachel. She’s barely able to speak.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m thankful... for Ellie... Rachel quickly looks down, not able to continue. Louis breaks the tension by serving up food onto everyone’s pla Ellie just watches Rachel. Studying her.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No, I am thankful. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (to Louis) You didn’t tell her I was back because you knew she wouldn’t let me stay. She wants me dead again. UNDER THE TABLE we see Ellie holding the scalpel in her h

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) I know you’re planning on killing me. I can see it in your face.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Ellie... stop... please...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We're your parents. We will always love you. No matter what --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: That’s another lie! The house rumbles as if an earthquake were starting. A picture frame slides down the wall shattering on the grou CLOSE on Ellie’s face, glaring at her mother --  92.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (cold) You chose Gage over me. Rachel doesn’t answer. She can’t. Her ability to speak arrested by the realization they are now suddenly outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow the family is sitting around the dining room tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks at Louis, terror rising in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: She's doing this... Louis looks around. Wind blowing through the trees. Aspha under his feet. Lane markers stretching out behind them. Gage giggles, banging on his plate --

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: I like trees! Ellie stands, scalpel by her side as she walks toward Rac

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: The day of Gage’s party. You saw him in the road and made a choice. Rachel keeps her eyes on Ellie but we notice something el Bright HEADLIGHTS approaching behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of a truck downshifting. The grinding o gears. The bellowing of exhaust. But -- Rachel keeps her eyes on Ellie, shaking her head --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I didn’t choose... I didn’t have time... I just saw Gage there... Louis looks behind Rachel into the oncoming headlights. LOUIS’ POV of the TRUCK barrelling right at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he looks back at Ellie he sees blackness swirling in eyes. For the first time Louis clearly sees her as someth other than his daughter. A monster. Hungry and evil.  93.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Stop... The headlights swallow them up as Ellie stands in front o Rachel, hair blowing in the wind, streaks of swamp water leaking out of her black eyes and down her face. She smil

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: How does it feel knowing you’re about to die? The scalpel in her hand glints as she moves her arm but - Louis lunges from behind, pulling Ellie down to the table WIDE on the family in the road: table cloth billowing in wind, Louis holding Ellie down by her shoulders. The truck approaching from the side at 70 miles per hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Louis’ face --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Stop it, El.... STOP IT!!! He glances over to SEE -- Rachel standing up, crying as the truck races up behind h Ellie slices at Louis’ arm and slides out of his grip. Th truck BLARES its horn. Brakes hiss and squeal as -- Louis dives for Rachel pulling her out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis hits the ground with Rachel in his arms, rolling ou the path of the truck. They turn to look back as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE to Gage’s awestruck face, sitting in his high cha as we HEAR the truck destroying everything in its path. Louis screams, covering Rachel from flying debris as the truck roars past them in a cloud of dust. Then it’s quiet Louis and Rachel open their eyes to SEE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is back to normal. The walls have returned. The table neatly set. Steam wafts off pasta in the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything just the way it was. Louis slowly stands --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: That thing is not our daughter. Rachel turns, noticing Gage’s chair sitting empty.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Louis, she took Gage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie leading Gage up the trail. Gage stumbles along, but he’s frightened. She grips his wrist, pulling him faster.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Where are we going? They pass the PET SEMATARY sign, winding into the woods -

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Somewhere special.

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go somewhere special. I’m scared. Ellie glance down at her brother, eyes smudged with black

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to be with me?

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: We can be together forever. Ellie pulls Gage further up the trail as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They Louis and Rachel search the house for Gage and Ellie. look in the basement, kitchen, inside closets.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Go upstairs. I'’11 look outside.  95.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What’s she going to do, Louis? Louis looks at her for a moment, sick with panic --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We'll find him. Go. Louis runs out the front door as Rachel runs upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie leads Gage down to the edge of the swamp. Fog curls over the black water. She stands there for a moment, eyes closed, breathing in.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: When you’re like me you won't be scared anymore. She opens her eyes, glancing at Gage --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can see in the dark now. You'd like that, wouldn’t you. Ellie pulls her brother to the water, his feet squashing the wet mud. Gage looks over to see something in her hand The glimmer of their father’s SCALPEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie walks out into the water, pulling her brother along

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can see so many things now... CLOSE on Gage whispering to himself, building up courage

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: One... two... three! Gage shoves Ellie and she drops the scalpel. Ellie screams as the blade swirls down into the muddy wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gage pulls away, running into the trees as Ellie reaches the shallow water, searching for the knife. BEHIND HER Gage slips away into the trees.  96.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Gage, come back! After a moment, she comes up with the knife in her hand. She turns, listening to the woods for a moment. Then she follows. INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Rachel searches the frantically. Under the bed and in the closet. She moves over to the window, looking out to SEE Jud’s house through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel runs down the driveway, ducking into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel comes out of the trees in front of Jud’s house. She pauses, looking up at the house. A single light on.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie walks through the trees, searching for her brother. She's angry, her eyes appearing black again as she passes through a shaft of moonlight. She pauses, calling out --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Gage, come out! I promise it won't hurt. I don’t want to be alone. She listens for a moment, then keeps walking. The scalpel glimmers in the moonlight by her side as she passes us. She slips away through the trees.  97.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (voice fading) Gage? Please. Where are you? After she’s gone we HOLD for a moment, then -- Gage peeks out from inside some bushes. He slides out fro his hiding place, running back to the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gage comes running down the trail. In the distance we hea his father calling out for him.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gage? GAGE? Gage runs down the trail, coming around the bend to FIND Louis running up the trail toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs into his daddy’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re safe now. I got you. Louis looks around in the darkness --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s Ellie?

dialogues.speaker: GAGE
dialogues.text: Out there. Gage points to the dark woods. Louis nods, walking quickl back down the trail to the house in the background.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Okay... okay. Let’s get you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis walks into the silent house holding Gage in his arm The doors are open, the night wind blowing in from outsid

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Rach? Rachel, I got Gage. No answer from the house. Louis sees Rachel’s purse on the table and goes over, dig out her car keys.  98.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come with me, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis puts Gage inside the station wagon, standing him on front seat so Gage can hold the steering wheel and look o

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I want you to hide right here until I find mommy, okay? Don’t come out for anyone. Even Ellie. Gage nods.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you see your sister, I want you to honk. Understand? Gage nods again. He looks scared. Louis steps back closin the door. He presses the key and the car bleeps. Locked. Then he turns and walks off. Heading back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel pushes open the door to the dark cottage. Taxiderm staring down from dark wood walls. She clicks on a light Empty beers on the table, ashtrays filled with butts.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jud? It’s Rachel. You home? The house is quiet. Rachel walks across the room into the kitchen. She looks down the hallway to the back bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jud? Rachel walks toward the bedroom. No answer. Rachel reaches into the doorway, feeling along the wall for the light. Her fingers find the switch and - CLICK! The bedroom light comes on and we SEE -- Jud’s body lying in a pool of blood. Part of his skull missing. Flies buzz around exposed brain matter. Feeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel screams, turning away. Then she remembers somethin  99. There was_a REVOLVER in Jud’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel forces herself to look again. She slowly moves closer, stepping over sticky blood squirming with maggots She winces, holding her breath as she reaches Jud’s hand, sliding the gun out of his stiff fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel has a flashlight and the revolver. Sweeping the li through the trees as she runs up the trail after Ellie. She's focused and determined. Ready to end this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis stands on the grass, looking out to the woods. We can see the beam of Rachel’s flashlight in the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel walks into the clearing. The moon lights rings of graves from above. She walks around the crooked stones, sweeping her flashli around as she searches for Ellie. The forest is dark and quiet. BEHIND HER we see a SHADOW slipping through the mist. She turns, hearing the grass moving. Small footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ellie? Rachel swings the light past us, pointing the gun. After beam passes in front of camera we NOTICE -- Ellie now standing behind her mother. Scalpel in her hand

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Biffer. One helluva sniffer. (beat) Kinda liked to bite people, too. Rachel closes her eyes, sensing the girl behind her. Ellie moves closer a few steps, shrouded in moonlight.  100. Almost _a_ ghost.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, El. I should have protected you. I love you. Rachel bites her lip, building up courage and SPINS AROUN BAM!! The bullet hits one of the gravestones. Rachel swin the flashlight to find Ellie but the girl slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis pauses in the trail, hearing the gun shot.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Rach? RACH??? Fear fills his veins as he runs faster up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel moving through the graveyard, swinging the light. A shadow moves in the mist, the sound of grass behind her Rachel turns again, shaking with fear, holding out the gu

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Please, El... stop... Rachel moves past a tree and we see a shadow move. She tu the light and catches a glimpse of Ellie darting away. BAM! The bullet zings through the trees. Rachel moves closer, hands shaking as she peers around th tree. More graves and mist. No sign of Ellie. From the darkness we hear a voice --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Please don’t hurt me mommy. The flashlight flickers. Losing power. Rachel turns aroun gripping the gun, lip quivering, losing her resolve --  101.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (whispering to herself) You’re not my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I’m scared. BACK ON RACHEL as her hand shakes, listening --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mommy. Rachel freezes. The voice is moving. Getting nearer -- Something is running in the darkness, she spins around as ELLIE LUNGES AT HER MOTHER WITH THE SCALPEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie screams as she swings the blade, eyes wild. Rachel screams, falling backwards as the blade cuts her h She drops the gun and the flashlight in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel hits the ground, clutching her bleeding hand. She hears footsteps in the grass and crawls to the flashlight, grabbing it and swinging around to SEE -- The gun lying in the grass. Ellie running for it. Rachel lunges out, grabbing Ellie’s leg and pulling her t the ground. Ellie kicks at her mother, sliding free. Rachel jumps up, scrambling for the gun but it’s too late Ellie rises up in the curling mist -- POINTING THE REVOLVER AT HER MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is surrounded by graves. Helpless. Facing Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ellie. Please... Rachel steps closer, her arms out, begging for mercy --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you. A smile curls on Ellie’s lips. Her eyes pure black.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Love you, too, mommy.  102. Ellie slowly squeezes the trigger and BAM!!! The gun goes off as Louis jumps out of the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls away, into the grass. The woods are quiet. Rachel screams, running up to see the bullet hole over hi heart. Louis tries to speak, blood gurgling out his mouth

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Louis... oh god, no, please... Rachel drops to her knees, clutching Louis. Her heart bre all over again as his life slips away.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I love... you. His eyes go blank. Rachel screams, clutching him again --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Louis, please... please... Rachel sobs over her husband, broken and shattered. Ellie steps into frame, mist curling around her feet as s points the gun at the back of her mother’s head. But ther something about her mother’s pain, watching her cry... Ellie lowers the gun, stepping closer, leaning down -- CLOSE on Ellie’s lips whispering into Rachel's ear as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light spreads through the trees as dew drips off the leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE IN on the car parked in the driveway. Windows steame Gage lies curled up on the front seat, asleep. As we settle on his sleeping form, suddenly -- TWO HANDS hit the driver’s window. Gage wakes up to SEE -  103. Ellie standing outside the car, smiling at Gage. Gage looks nervous until he sees his mother walking up th lawn. She unlocks the car and reaches in for Gage. Rachel walks over to the front porch, sitting with Gage i her lap. She looks exhausted, gazing out to the woods. A piece of her soul missing. We see her hands -- They're raw with BLISTERS and DIRTY. WIDEN OUT to REVEAL -- Ellie on the grass in front of them. She’s dancing. Happy She moves around the yard, tracing her fingers through th air as she silently runs through her routine. A sound in the woods behind her. Rachel looks up. A SHADOW falls across the lawn in front of Ellie. She sto dancing, looking right up at us. CLOSE on her face for a moment, filled with awe and surpr Then she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Daddy! CUT TO BLACK.
